task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block, align the circular end-effector, establish contact, push the block along a straight direction toward the marked goal, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop pushing task with a UR-style arm and a circular end-effector. The robot must observe a T-shaped block, localize a fixed goal mark on the workspace, approach the block, orient its tool, verify contact gently, and perform a straight push so the block moves toward the goal area. The sequence favors robust perception (visibility check with recovery scan), precise alignment, and a guarded approach before a single long push. The scene shows a red T block and a drawn circular goal.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except the T block and goal mark
Robot reachable workspace covers block and goal
stepwise_plan: Check/obtain visibility of the T block
Check/obtain visibility of the goal mark
Move above the block and set yaw
Approach and align to the push pose
Execute a straight push toward the goal
success_criteria: Block translates toward/into the marked goal region
No loss of contact before the planned push distance
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: If block not visible, re-detect it
If goal not visible, raster scan to find it
If contact not detected, re-approach and retry the push once
task_long_description.termination: Tree returns SUCCESS after completing the push and retreat; returns FAILURE if perception or push repeatedly fail.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Check visibility of the T block.
Run detection to localize the T block.
Check visibility of the goal marker.
Raster scan to find the goal marker.
Move to a safe approach height above the block.
Orient the tool for a lateral push.
Lateral approach and alignment to push pose.
Guarded Z-in until contact is sensed.
Execute straight push toward goal direction.
Back off to a safe, non-contact pose.

recovery_strategy: Fallback to detection/scan if visibility checks fail
Retreat if unexpected contact forces occur
assumptions: Frames show a red T and a blue drawn goal; instruction mentions gray block and green targetâ€”we follow the frames.
Goal direction inferred from object motion; exact metric goal pose not provided.
10Hz observation/control noted but not explicitly encoded in timeouts; assumed handled by controller.

expected_success_criteria: Block reaches or clearly approaches the goal circle
No collisions except intended contact with the block
Robot ends detached from the block
